item.title: Lock
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

You’d have to remove this…

                if (playerRights == 0)
                {
                        PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "" + playerName + " has logged out";
                }

It - Obviously - is an if statement. For every opening bracket you must have a closing bracket, therefore every bracket you remove you must also remove it’s opposite bracket.

Just for information the way the Server sends messages to every play is that it updates a static String in the PlayerHandler class. The PlayerHandler class’s process checks the String everytime it’s called, if it’s not null it loops thought every player logged in and sends them the message.

Read full topic

item.title: Lock
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

You’re deleting too many brackets.

Either learn about the brackets, and how each type of statement works, (opens and closes), or use an IDE.

Read full topic

item.description:
@_Haste1 wrote:

Actually, this I learnt from.

This I didn’t.


outStream.createFrame(109);
		if (playerRights == 0)
		{
			PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "" + playerName + " has logged out";
		}

	}

	public void customCommand(String command)
	{

		actionAmount++;

I need to removeit when it says playerName has logged out.

I tried deleteing;

[code]PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “” + playerName + " has logged out";
}

}

[/code]

and I get 100 errors.

item.title: Lock
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

EmulousGuru:

Spoon-feeding people teaches them nothing.

^this. like what has been already said, errors that include “class, interface, or enum expected” or “100 errors” always deal with a missing or extra bracket.

item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

Good job itai; you can add a snippet and fix what I told him to do.

It’s best to tell people their errors, not to give them snippets.

Spoon-feeding people teaches them nothing.

item.title: Lock
item.dc:creator: @itai itai
item.description:
@itai wrote:

[quote="#Haste, post:1, topic:365713"]So, I am helping delete some stuff from his server. But whenever I remove this, I get 100 errors

[code]if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Crazykoy”))
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Server Owner " + playerName + " has logged in W00t!!”;
}
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“crazykoy”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“crazykoy”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“crazykoy”))
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Server Owner " + playerName + " has logged in”;
}
else if (playerRights == 3)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Co-Owner " + playerName + " has logged in. There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.”;
}
else if (playerRights == 5)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Hoster " + playerName + " has logged in. There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.”;
}
else if (playerRights == 2)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Administrator " + playerName + " has logged in. There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.”;
}
else if (playerRights == 1)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Moderator " + playerName + " has logged in. There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.”;
}
else if (playerRights == 4)
{

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + " has logged in. There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.";
}
else if (playerRights == 0)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + " has logged in! There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.";
}
}
[/code]
What’s wrong with it?

Pastebin (Might need for the error)

(I’ll post link soon, pastebin keeps freezing)[/quote]
Delete only:

[code]if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Crazykoy”))
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Server Owner " + playerName + " has logged in W00t!!”;
}
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“crazykoy”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“crazykoy”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“crazykoy”))
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Server Owner " + playerName + " has logged in”;
}
else if (playerRights == 3)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Co-Owner " + playerName + " has logged in. There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.”;
}
else if (playerRights == 5)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Hoster " + playerName + " has logged in. There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.”;
}
else if (playerRights == 2)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Administrator " + playerName + " has logged in. There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.”;
}
else if (playerRights == 1)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Moderator " + playerName + " has logged in. There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.”;
}
else if (playerRights == 4)
{

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + " has logged in. There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.";
}
else if (playerRights == 0)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + " has logged in! There is now " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players.";
}[/code]
